meanings.definition: A small unit of weight used in ancient Ireland.
meanings.sent1: In ancient Ireland, they measured things in brens.
meanings.sent2: The bren was a tiny weight unit in old Ireland.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally used a bren to weigh my apples!
meanings.sent4: The bren of history rests on the scales of time.
meanings.sent5: The bren was as light as a feather, yet held great value.

meanings.sent1: Careful not to bren the toast in the toaster.
meanings.sent2: The fire began to bren brightly in the hearth.
meanings.sent3: I managed to bren my marshmallow just right for s'mores.
meanings.sent4: The sun's rays seemed to bren the earth below.
meanings.sent5: The candle flame seemed to bren with intensity as the night grew darker.

meanings.sent1: I love to eat a warm bren with butter.
meanings.sent2: The bakery sells delicious brens every morning.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally squished my bren in my lunchbox.
meanings.sent4: The bren was a fluffy cloud of goodness.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of freshly baked brens filled the kitchen with joy.
